title.en: Intellectual Property Protection in the Field of Information Technology

description.en: The course allows students to put the knowledge and skills acquired throughout the curriculum to test in solving actual problems in the ICT sector. The assignments will be organized via TechStartup Legal Clinic and students will spend most of their time advising startups.
description.et: Aine võimaldab üliõpilastel panna õppekava vältel omandatud teadmised ja oskused proovile elulises olukorras. Õppetöö korraldatakse nn TechStartup Legal Clinic raames, kus üliõpilased enamik oma ajast nõustavad startup ettevõtjaid.

objectives.en: 1) to embed the knowledge and skills obtained during studies,
objectives.et: 1) siduda teadmised ja oskused, mis õpingute ajal on omandatud;

objectives.en: 2) to prepare for professional activity in the area of IT law by opening working in a technology startup as one career option;
objectives.et: 2) valmistada ette professionaalseks karjääriks IT-õiguses, avades ühe karjäärivõimalusena töötamise tehnoloogia idufirmas;

objectives.en: 3) to create additional incentives to acquire new knowledge and skills,
objectives.et: 3) luua võimalusi uute teadmiste ja oskuste omandamiseks;

objectives.en: 4) to apply common sense and past experience on how to network, listen and talk with tech startup clients,
objectives.et: 4) kasutada loogikat ja oma kogemusi, et suhelda, kuulata ning rääkida tehnoloogia idufirmadest klientidega;

objectives.en: 5) to solve problems of IT law of tech startup  clients in a professional manner,
objectives.et: 5) lahendada tehnoloogia idufirmast kliendi IT-õiguse alaseid probleeme professionaalselt;

objectives.en: 6) to operate in a team in an efficient and cooperative way.

learning_outcomes.en: Student who has completed the practice:
1)  has experienced and practiced how to solve actual problems in IT law in technology startup companies;
learning_outcomes.et: 1) on kogenud ja harjutanud, kuidas päriselus lahendatakse tehnoloogia idufirmade IT-õiguse alaseid küsimusi;

learning_outcomes.en: 2) Knows what the opportunities and challenges are working with technology startups on a position requiring legal education;
learning_outcomes.et: 2) teab, millised on võimalused ja väljakutsed tehnoloogia idufirmade juures juriidilist haridust nõudval töökohal töötades;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) Has experienced and knows how to plan the work of a group, including has practiced leading a group;
learning_outcomes.et: 3) on kogenud ja oskab planeerida grupitööd, sh harjutanud meeskonna juhtimist;

independent_work.et:
1. You will be divided into teams of 4-5 people, each member will be team leader for 1 month with first team leader being assigned by the course supervisor.

2. You should visit accelerators, incubators or hubs to find your client or you can choose any client you know in your work or studies who could qualify as a technology startup (it is recommended to inform the place you are visiting beforehand and explain what is your plan, if unsure regarding whether client fits the profile - consult with course supervisor).

3. You must enter all of the time you spend on the practice into excel (with following specifics: client, issue, what did you do, time spent on it) and at the end of every month send a report to your team leader and the course supervisor (4 report for 4 months).

4. Every team must deal with appr. 10 legal problems from either the same startup or many startups (problem is not merely one question about the one issue, it is a wholesome problem like - how to set up a company). The legal problem does not have to be only IT law related problem.

5. Every team leader must report regarding team management once per month to the course supervisor (the report must indicate: the difficulties in the team, is asking team members to do stuff for free on a deadline difficult for you, who is not doing the work, who misses deadlines, who is unwilling to learn).

6. Your solution to legal problems will not be assessed in this course, you must yourself be sure of this solution or not provide it. If you need help in reaching a solution you may contact any lecturer in the IT Law programme or the course supervisor for guidance. If there is no solution or you cannot find one, you must tell this to the client.

7. It is crucial that you abide by the CCBE Code of Conduct - first and foremost keep client data confidential and maintain the trust of the client. Team leaders must make sure the data is kept confidential and no client data is in jeopardy also after this course.

8. You can choose on your own the methods of communication and storage of files in your team - consider also confidentiality and security of information in making such decisions.

9. Most of the 47 h must be spent on solving legal problems of clients. Up to 7 h you may spend on finding your clients (e.g. networking events, meetings, visiting hubs or accelerators).

Members of the Bar Association who are not allowed by the Bar rules to participate in this practice will receive a separate independent work.

description.et:
Assessment criteria:

- proficiency in solving the case:
- proficiency in implementing theory in practice and communication with client;
- proficiency in analysing legal problems, logical and consistent topic discussion;
- submitting reports in due time.

Solving problems of three clients, communicating the solution to the client and saving the materials according to instructions.
Pass - 51 - 100%
Fail - 0 - 50%

grade_preconditions.et:
1. One report submitted as team leader on deadline
2. Monthly reports submitted of hours in excel on deadline
3. 47 h spent on the course as individual work
4. No serious client complaints
5. No serious team leader complaints
6. No breach of CCBE Code of Conduct

Deadlines are confirmed in the first seminar.

grade_evaluation.et: All 6 conditions of admission to assessment must be present to pass.
